Both | Under 65 | All incomes: The map reveals stark regional disparities, with uninsured rates clustering highest across southern and southwestern counties, especially in Texas and Oklahoma. In contrast, northeastern states and the District of Columbia exhibit notably lower rates, reflecting broader coverage. Kenedy County, Texas, stands out as an extreme outlier with exceptionally high uninsured levels, while Los Alamos County, New Mexico, reports the lowest. These patterns highlight persistent gaps in health coverage tied to geography and state policy differences.
